text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with chocolate cream puffs swans
that's right word to your moms I'm here
to drop swans
yes Mother's Day is right around the
corner and what says I love you mom
better than a chocolate and cream filled
decorative bird and while they may look
very difficult to do kind of complex
they're totally not they're super easy
and the first step is the dough so to
get started we're going to melt some
butter and some cold fresh water over
medium heat and we'll also throw in a
little pinch of salt and basically all
we're going to do is wait for this to
come up to a simmer and as soon as we
see that start to bubble we'll give it a
stir and then we're going to go ahead
and dump in our flour all at once no
gradual stirring dump it in and start
stirring with your wooden spoon and
what's going to happen in about 30
seconds to a minute that's going to all
come together kind of pull away from the
sides and it should look something like
that so this is going to happen very
quickly so don't go anywhere just dump
in your flour and keep stirring until it
kind of pulls away from the sides and
forms what looks like kind of a greasy
dough and once that's happened and it
looks like that we're going to go ahead
and pull it off the heat and we're going
to let it sit for about ten minutes
before we mix in our eggs now at this
point while it's still hot I'm going to
add one optional ingredient a little bit
of sugar classically this dough does not
have sugar in it but since we are going
to use these for cream puffs I'm going
to put a little bit in and yes if you're
wondering you could you just add that
sugar right to the water and once it's
cooled for about ten or fifteen minutes
I'm going to go ahead and stir in two
eggs one at a time so we're going to
crack in one large egg we're to use our
wooden spoon to stir it in and after a
few seconds you're going to be convinced
this is not working
because it looks horrible it looks
separated it looks all slimy and broken
but don't worry just keep stirring and
eventually you'll get some traction and
it'll go from slimy to sticky and you're
going to keep mixing it until it looks
like that and then go ahead and add your
second egg and mix that in thoroughly
and the same thing is going to happen
you're going to be like oh no I broke it
I've disappointed mother again now you
have it relaxed just keep stirring and
then once that second egg is mixed in
and it looks like that stop and transfer
that into a piping bag or you could just
use a plastic bag that's what i'm going
to use so i spoon that into a freezer
bag i'm gonna go ahead and cut off the
corner and a pretty big cut for the
bodies of these swans we want a good
amount of dough and
go ahead and start piping and basically
what we're looking for is kind of a
roundish Ovilus shape that will just
kind of pull and taper off at the end
something like that and I did a few and
I thought they were looking pretty good
but then my muscle memory from culinary
school 30 years ago kicked in and my
wrist was like don't keep the bag flat
against the pan
pull it up at like a 45 degree angle you
will get a much more Swan like torso so
that's how we did the last few although
as you'll see it really doesn't matter
and speaking of not mattering don't be
afraid to pipe right down to the end
even though they might look a little
screwed up on the pan and you may
totally fail trying to fix it with your
fingertip like I did here you'll see
when they bake they look amazing so
we're gonna go ahead and pipe out our
Swan bodies at that point we're going to
go ahead and put those in the center of
a very well preheated 425 degree oven
for about 20 minutes or until
beautifully browned and while those are
cooking we're going to go ahead and make
our heads and necks so kind of the same
idea we're going to take some of our
dough only this time I'm putting it in a
small plastic bag with a much smaller
opening in the corner and we're
basically going to make the heads and
necks by piping an ass kind of a skinny
S shape and then once the S is done
we'll go back to the top and kind of
pipe a little bit of a head shape and
kind of pull away to make the mouth
although ideally it doesn't look like
the heads been run over so it took me a
couple to get it down but just like with
the body the old muscle memory came back
and I remembered the key to the head was
the quick pull away so we're going to
pipe out some necks and as you can see
I'm using sill Pat's on the baking
sheets you can also use parchment paper
and once those are done we'll go ahead
and pop those in the oven too and the
heads and necks are only going to take
about 10 to 12 minutes so I do like to
pop those in about halfway through the
baking time of the bodies so when that
timer rings the heads and body should be
pretty much finished together and the
next will look something like this
the bodies were also done perfectly like
I said you want to cook those until
they're beautifully browned and by the
way I'm just pulling them out of the
oven here to give you a look we're going
to put those right back in the oven
which is turned off at this point I'm
going to open the oven door to let most
of the heat out and then I'm just going
to crack the door open and let those sit
there cooling in that warm oven until
completely cooled and that's going to
help dry them out a little bit give them
a better texture so let them cool
completely in the oven and at that point
it's ready to build our Birds all we're
going to do is cut off about the top
third I usually like to cut from the
larger end to the tapered end
so we're going to cut that off like that
and as you'll notice these are pretty
much hollow which makes them ideal for
stuffing with things and then for the
wings we'll simply cut that top in half
and that's it so simple and then once
those are prepped we're going to go
ahead and fill the bottoms with
chocolate ganache and as you may know
all that is hot cream poured over
chopped dark chocolate we let it sit
there for a couple minutes and then we
stir it and it doesn't look good right
away kind of like when we were mixing in
the eggs but in just a few seconds it
comes together into a beautiful
beautiful shiny chocolate ganache and
then once our chocolate ganache is done
we're gonna go ahead and fill the
bottoms of our cream puffs
you could spoon it in if you want but
that's really messy so I went with the
old plastic bag trick again but anyway
we're going to fill those bottoms with
chocolate and when that cools it's
basically going to be the same texture
is like a chocolate truffle and then
once our birds have been chocolate 'add
we'll go ahead and pipe in some sweet
and whipped cream no you're not allowed
to use that stuff in the tub and here
you can see I am using the piping bag
with a star tip so I can get some
feather like texture so we're going to
go ahead and fill those up with whipped
cream and be generous this is after all
the cream puffs and then after those are
filled we're going to go ahead and take
our wings put one on each side and of
course raise your hand if you were going
to put both wings on one side but anyway
we'll stick in those wings I'm not sure
if it looks better with the flat side up
or the rounded side up it probably
doesn't make a difference in fact I
think I mixed a couple and then once
those wings have been stuck in the last
step of course we're going to complete
the look with a neck and head just push
it down in and that chocolate cream puff
Swan is finally taking shape and right
here this is why you want to make a few
extra heads oops
anyway we're going to go ahead and
finish those off and if you're not going
to serve them right away you're going to
want to keep them chilled otherwise that
whipped cream is going to start getting
a little weird
and then when you are ready to present
these to mom we will finish them off in
style with a little bit of powdered
sugar we will dust those good and proper
and those chocolate cream puff swans are
officially done check it out so for such
a simple recipe really does look
impressive but anyways mom will tell you

I go head neck first then I'll tear off

and of course mom's just going to think
